title: A braidoid equivalence for spherical knotoids
abstract:
Braidoids form a counterpart theory to the theory of planar knotoids, just as
braids do for three-dimensional links. As such, planar knotoid diagrams
represent the same knotoid in $\mathbb{R}^2$ if and only if they can be
presented as the closure of two labeled braidoid diagrams related by an
equivalence relation, named $L$-equivalence. In this paper, we refine the
notion of $L$-equivalence of braidoid diagrams in order to obtain an
equivalence theorem for (multi)-knotoid diagrams in $S^2$ when represented as
the closure of labeled braidoid diagrams.
